config.question: Which of the following incidents marked the beginning of the new navy of United States?

answer_3.response: In 1883, Congress authorized construction of four steel ships, marking the beginning of the new navy. Between 1885 and 1889, Congress budgeted funds for 30 more ships. The initial building program focused on lightly armored fast cruisers for raiding enemy merchant ships and protecting American shores, but after 1890, it shifted to constructing a seagoing offensive battleship navy capable of challenging the strongest fleets of Europe.
